item.title: Huawei finance chief Meng Wanzhou to appear in court as Chinese media react furiously to arrest - The Independent
item.description:
Huawei finance chief Meng Wanzhou to appear in court as Chinese media react furiously to arrest  The Independent

Huawei’s finance chief is set to appear at a bail hearing in Vancouver on Friday amid a backlash in Chinese media over her detention. Chief financial officer Meng Wanzhou, daughter of Huawei founder Ren Zhengfei, was arrested by Canadian authorities on Saturday at the request of the US government which is seeking extradition. No official reason has been given but it is thought to be linked to alleged violations of US sanctions on Iran. Stock markets calmed on Friday following a tumultuous session on Thursday as news of Ms Meng’s detention prompted fears of a new front on the US-China trade ...

item.title: US case against Huawei CFO revealed in Canadian court - CNN
item.description:
US case against Huawei CFO revealed in Canadian court  CNN

The United States is claiming that the chief financial officer of Chinese tech giant Huawei covered up violations of sanctions on Iran, according to Canadian prosecutors. Meng Wanzhou, who was arrested in Vancouver and faces extradition to the United States, is believed to have helped Huawei circumvent US sanctions by telling financial institutions that a Huawei subsidiary was a separate company, prosecutors said at a hearing Friday to determine whether Meng should be released on bail. Her lawyer said that she has ties to Canada and is not a flight risk. The judge, after hearing arguments f...

item.title: Huawei pledges $2bn in effort to allay UK security concerns - The Guardian
item.description:
Huawei pledges $2bn in effort to allay UK security concerns  The Guardian

The Chinese telecoms giant Huawei is to spend $2bn (£1.5bn) in an effort to alleviate British security services’ concerns about vulnerabilities in its products, capping a torrid week for the firm. In July, a British government centre established to verify the integrity of Huawei’s technology warned that it had security concerns about the company’s technology and could only provide “limited assurance” that risks to national security had been mitigated. On Thursday BT confirmed it was removing Huawei equipment from key areas of its 4G network over concerns about the Chinese firm’s presence in...

item.title: 🇨🇳Huawei CFO’s arrest rattles investors, markets tumble l Al Jazeera English - Al Jazeera English
item.description:
🇨🇳Huawei CFO’s arrest rattles investors, markets tumble l Al Jazeera English  Al Jazeera English

American stocks clawed back much of the ground lost in an early plunge triggered by the news of the arrest of Huawei Technologies CFO, Meng Wanzhou, in Canada at the United States’ request. The initial drop joined a global rout, reviving worries over trade tensions. Meng’s arrest threatens to drive a wedge between the US and China just days after they agreed on a 90-day trade-war truce in Argentina on Saturday. Al Jazeera's Kristen Saloomey reports. - Subscribe to our channel: http://aje.io/AJSubscribe - Follow us on Twitter: https://twitter.com/AJEnglish - Find us on Facebook: https://www....

item.title: Huawei appoints chairman as interim CFO following arrest of Meng Wanzhou - The Telegraph
item.description:
Huawei appoints chairman as interim CFO following arrest of Meng Wanzhou  The Telegraph

Chinese telecoms giant Huawei has appointed chairman Liang Hua as interim chief financial officer following the arrest of his predecessor in Canada. Mr Liang has been a part of the company since 1995 and takes up the position following the arrest of Meng Wanzhou at Vancouver airport in an escalating trade dispute. She is due to face a bail hearing later today pending possible extradition to the US. The US Department of Justice requested the arrest over allegations that Huawei had violated US sanctions on Iran. The US probe revolves around Huawei’s use of HSBC to make illegal transactions to...

item.title: Meng Wanzhou Was Huawei’s Professional Face, Until Her Arrest - The New York Times
item.description:
Meng Wanzhou Was Huawei’s Professional Face, Until Her Arrest  The New York Times

BEIJING — As Huawei’s finance chief and daughter of its founder, Meng Wanzhou has been a polished, professional face for a huge technology firm that long was opaque to the outside world. Ms. Meng, the eldest daughter of Ren Zhengfei, the leader of the telecom equipment maker, has appeared before reporters to announce the company’s financial results. She has spoken at company events in New York; Cancún, Mexico; and beyond. She helped inaugurate centers in Britain, a key market for the Chinese giant’s expansion into the Western world. She also sat on the board of a Huawei partner company in H...

item.title: Peter Navarro: Huawei is a bad actor - CNN
item.description:

White House trade adviser Peter Navarro addresses the arrest of Huawei's CFO saying the "timing was unusual but the actions were legitimate." ©2018 Cable News Network, Inc. A WarnerMedia Company. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Who is Meng Wanzhou, the Chinese exec wanted by the US? - CNN
item.description:
Who is Meng Wanzhou, the Chinese exec wanted by the US?  CNN

Meng Wanzhou, the CFO of Chinese tech giant Huawei, has kept a low profile for much of her career. Now she's at the center of a geopolitical drama between the world's two largest economies. The 46-year-old executive was arrested Saturday in Canada, and faces extradition to the United States. After news of her arrest broke late Wednesday, Meng's face was splashed across the internet. Meng is the daughter of Huawei's billionaire founder, Ren Zhangfei, and her case threatens to ramp up tensions between Washington and Beijing. "The fact that this is Ren's daughter and a very senior official in ...

item.title: Huawei arrest stokes fears of China reprisals among America Inc executives - Reuters
item.description:
Huawei arrest stokes fears of China reprisals among America Inc executives  Reuters

At a closed-door security meeting of U.S. companies in Singapore on Thursday, one topic was high on the agenda: the arrest of a top executive at Chinese tech giant Huawei [HWT.UL] and the potential backlash on American firms operating in China. Officials from major U.S. companies who attended the event, a scheduled meeting of the local chapter of the U.S. Department of State's Overseas Security Advisory Council (OSAC), voiced concerns about retaliation against American firms and their executives, two people with knowledge of the meeting said. A number of attendees said their companies were ...

item.title: China's Huawei appoints chairman as acting CFO after executive's arrest - Reuters
item.description:
China's Huawei appoints chairman as acting CFO after executive's arrest  Reuters

China's Huawei Technologies has appointed Chairman Liang Hua as acting chief financial officer (CFO) following the arrest in Canada of its CFO, who faces extradition to the United States, staff briefed on an internal memo told Reuters. Huawei did not immediately respond to a request for comment. CFO Meng Wanzhou, who is also the daughter of Huawei founder Ren Zhengfei, was detained in Canada on Saturday at the request of U.S. authorities. (Reporting By Sijia Jiang in HONG KONG and Yilei Sun in BEIJING; Editing by Anne Marie Roantree and Kim Coghill)

item.title: Huawei Executive's Arrest Threatens To Derail Company's Global Ambitions - Forbes
item.description:
Huawei Executive's Arrest Threatens To Derail Company's Global Ambitions  Forbes

Attendees stand at the Huawei Technologies booth at the Mobile World Congress Shanghai on June 28, 2018. (Photo: Qilai Shen/Bloomberg) The arrest of a senior executive at telecom equipment supplier Huawei Technologies will likely give rise to more security concerns in other countries closely allied with the U.S. and jeopardize the company’s future revenue streams. Huawei’s Chief Financial Officer Meng Wanzhou, who is also the daughter of the company’s founder Ren Zhengfei, was detained in Vancouver and faces possible extradition to the U.S. While the charges against Meng haven’t been specif...

item.title: Greek Folli founders, executives charged with fraud, money laundering - source - Reuters UK
item.description:
Greek Folli founders, executives charged with fraud, money laundering - source  Reuters UK

A Greek prosecutor has laid felony charges against jewellery maker Folli Follie's founders and seven other executives for fraud and money laundering, a judicial source told Reuters on Friday. Folli, an upmarket Greek brand, has been under scrutiny since a hedge fund raised concerns over its financial statements for last year. Quintessential Capital Management said in a report in May that the company overstated the number of its outlets and questioned its accounting practices in Asia where it had expanded rapidly. The report sent Folli shares into a tailspin and prompted a legal investigatio...

item.title: Who Is Meng Wanzhou? - CNN
item.description:
Who Is Meng Wanzhou?  CNN

Meng Wanzhou, also known as Sabrina Meng and Cathy Meng, is the chief financial officer and deputy chairwoman of the board of Chinese tech firm Huawei. ©2018 Cable News Network, Inc. A WarnerMedia Company. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: 🇨🇦🇨🇳Canada arrests CFO of Chinese telecoms giant Huawei | Al Jazeera English - Al Jazeera English
item.description:
🇨🇦🇨🇳Canada arrests CFO of Chinese telecoms giant Huawei | Al Jazeera English  Al Jazeera English

Meng Wanzhou, chief financial officer of Chinese telecoms giant Huawei, has been arrested in Vancouver, Canada on December 1 and faces extradition to the United States. "She is sought for extradition by the United States, and a bail hearing has been set for Friday," Canada's justice ministry said, adding it could not provide further details due to a publication ban that was sought by and granted to Meng. Earlier this year, US media reported that the US was investigating Huawei for violating sanctions on Iran by selling network equipment to the country. Al Jazeera's Adrian Brown reports from...

item.title: Whaling Wars: A $12 Billion Financial Dragnet Targeting CFOs - Forbes
item.description:
Whaling Wars: A $12 Billion Financial Dragnet Targeting CFOs  Forbes

Source Getty: Targeted phishing and whaling attacks cast a wide net. Since 2013, more than $12 billion has been unwittingly sent by 78,617 firms through the successful exploitation of CFOs and finance leaders in the U.S., UK and Europe. These usually circumspect finance professionals have fallen prey to targeted social engineering and business email compromises euphemistically referred to as phishing when the target is small fry or whaling when the target is a corporate boss or well-heeled individual. In all, more than 50,000 CFOs have appeared on detailed databases typically used for targe...

item.title: Citi CFO forecasts lower markets revenue for fourth quarter - Reuters
item.description:
Citi CFO forecasts lower markets revenue for fourth quarter  Reuters

Citigroup Inc (C.N: Quote, Profile, Research, Stock Buzz) Chief Financial Officer John Gerspach said the bank expects market revenue in the current quarter to be slightly lower than last year. Gerspach, speaking at an investor conference in New York, said the fall was driven by a decline in fixed-income market revenue, while Citi's equity business is doing well. "We had anticipated we would actually see year-over-year revenue growth in fixed income and equity markets," he said. "But while we've maintained, I'd say, good engagement with the clients, we just haven't seen that transition into ...

Huawei's global chief financial officer is under arrest in Canada for reportedly violating U.S. sanctions against Iran. Gavino Garay reports.

item.title: Opinion: Huawei arrest creates concerns in Silicon Valley as well as abroad - MarketWatch
item.description:
Opinion: Huawei arrest creates concerns in Silicon Valley as well as abroad  MarketWatch

MARKETWATCH FIRST TAKE By Therese Poletti Detainment of Huawei CFO creates concerns for U.S. suppliers as well as clouds trade dispute with China China’s Huawei sells more than a quarter of the world’s telecom equipment. Reuters The arrest of Huawei Technologies Co.’s chief financial officer is sure to put a crimp in the Trump administration’s trade truce with China, as that highly sensitive issue gets more so, but investors are nervous about the impact the whole saga will have on Silicon Valley and abroad. On Thursday, shares of many chip and fiber-optic companies fell, helping fuel a mark...

item.title: John Bolton says he knew in advance Huawei executive would be arrested - The Guardian
item.description:
John Bolton says he knew in advance Huawei executive would be arrested  The Guardian

The US national security adviser, John Bolton, has said he knew in advance that a top Chinese telecoms executive would be arrested in Canada to face extradition to the US, in what is escalating into a major diplomatic incident. Beijing is calling for the release of Meng Wanzhou, the global chief financial officer of the vast Huawei corporation, and demanded Ottawa and Washington provide reasons for her arrest in Vancouver on Saturday. Related: Huawei Q&A: what you need to know about the Chinese phone maker Bolton would not give a specific reason for the US request, saying it was a law enfor...

item.title: What the Arrest of a Chinese Executive Means for the Stock Market - Barron's
item.description:
What the Arrest of a Chinese Executive Means for the Stock Market  Barron's

A massive drop in the Dow Jones Industrial Average was spurred by the arrest of Huawei CFO Meng Wanzhou. And it was a confirmation that tensions between the U.S. and China are about more than trade.

item.title: Huawei CFO Meng Wanzhou arrested in Canada - CNN
item.description:
Huawei CFO Meng Wanzhou arrested in Canada  CNN

Meng Wanzhou, the chief financial officer of Chinese tech company Huawei, has been arrested in Canada and is being sought for extradition by the US government. CNN's Matt Rivers has more. ©2018 Cable News Network, Inc. A WarnerMedia Company. All Rights Reserved.

item.title: Huawei CFO Meng Wanzhou arrested in Canada, faces extradition to United States - CNN
item.description:
Huawei CFO Meng Wanzhou arrested in Canada, faces extradition to United States  CNN

The chief financial officer of Chinese tech giant Huawei has been arrested in Canada. She faces extradition to the United States. Meng Wanzhou, also known as Sabrina Meng and Cathy Meng, was apprehended in Vancouver on December 1, according to Canadian Justice Department spokesman Ian McLeod. In addition to her role as CFO, Meng serves as deputy chairwoman of Huawei's board. She's the daughter of Huawei founder Ren Zhengfei. Meng "is sought for extradition by the United States, and a bail hearing has been set for Friday," McLeod said in a statement, which was first reported by The Globe and...

item.title: China Will Take Americans Hostage to Retaliate: Experts - Newsweek
item.description:
China Will Take Americans Hostage to Retaliate: Experts  Newsweek

Analysts have warned that the arrest of Huawei’s Chief Financial Officer Meng Wanzhou may have major repercussions for American tech companies and Washington’s ongoing trade war with China, with some experts suggesting that China could retaliate by arresting U.S. citizens. "Huawei is one of the Chinese government's pet companies," James Lewis, director of technology policy at the Center for Strategic and International Studies and a former Commerce Department official told Axios. "They will retaliate and China will take hostages,” he said. "If I was an American tech executive, I wouldn't tra...

item.title: Arrest of Huawei 'heiress' throws rare spotlight on family - Reuters
item.description:
Arrest of Huawei 'heiress' throws rare spotlight on family  Reuters

Like many top Chinese executives, Meng Wanzhou is a mysterious figure even in her home country, but the 46-year-old chief financial officer of Huawei Technologies had been widely tipped to one day take the helm of the tech giant her father founded. That was until her shock arrest in Canada at the request of U.S. authorities on Wednesday, a move that has entangled her in the protracted diplomatic tensions between Washington and Beijing. Her fate is now uncertain. A source familiar with the matter told Reuters the arrest stems from Huawei Technologies Co Ltd's [HWT.UL] alleged violation of U....

item.title: U.S. accuses Huawei CFO of Iran sanctions cover-up; hearing adjourned - Reuters
item.description:
U.S. accuses Huawei CFO of Iran sanctions cover-up; hearing adjourned  Reuters

Huawei Technologies Co Ltd's chief financial officer faces U.S. accusations that she covered up her company's links to a firm that tried to sell equipment to Iran despite sanctions, a Canadian prosecutor said on Friday, arguing against giving her bail while she awaits extradition. The case against Meng Wanzhou, who is also the daughter of the founder of Huawei [HWT.UL], stems from a 2013 Reuters report here about the company's close ties to Hong Kong-based Skycom Tech Co Ltd, which attempted to sell U.S. equipment to Iran despite U.S. and European Union bans, the prosecutor told a Vancouver...

item.title: Sage hires Jonathan Howell as new CFO amid firming up of executive team - The Telegraph
item.description:
Sage hires Jonathan Howell as new CFO amid firming up of executive team  The Telegraph

The UK's largest-listed technology company Sage has bolstered its senior executive team, moving Jonathan Howell into the chief financial officer post that had been previously held by new boss Steve Hare. Mr Howell, a current non-executive director at Sage, will start the role next week. He had previously served as group finance director at Close Brothers and, prior to that, had been chief financial officer of the London Stock Exchange Group. His appointment comes just over a month after Sage announced Mr Hare would become the company's chief executive, having held the position on an interim...

item.title: China's Huawei pledges $2 billion to allay British security fears: sources - Reuters
item.description:
China's Huawei pledges $2 billion to allay British security fears: sources  Reuters

China's Huawei [HWT.UL] will spend $2 billion as part of efforts to address security issues raised in a British government report earlier this year, sources with knowledge of the matter said on Friday. Huawei, the world's biggest producer of telecoms equipment, faces intense scrutiny in the West over its ties to the Chinese government and concerns its equipment could be used by Beijing for spying. The company has repeatedly denied the allegations. The British government report, signed off by Britain's GCHQ spy agency and released in July, found that technical and supply-chain issues with eq...

item.title: Patisserie Valerie appoints interim finance boss - Financial Times
item.description:
Patisserie Valerie appoints interim finance boss  Financial Times

Café chain Patisserie Valerie announced the appointment of an interim chief financial officer on Wednesday, a month after his predecessor resigned amid the company’s near collapse. Nick Perrin will take up the role until the board appoints a permanent CFO. Mr Perrin, who is not a member of the board, most recently served as finance director of Aim-listed veterinary services provider CVS, which saw revenues grow from £110m to £350m during his tenure, according to a statement by Patisserie Valerie. “I am pleased to welcome Nick to Patisserie Holdings. He brings with him the necessary experien...

item.title: Huawei CFO arrested in Canada as US seeks extradition - The Telegraph
item.description:
Huawei CFO arrested in Canada as US seeks extradition  The Telegraph

Canada has arrested the chief financial officer of Huawei, the Chinese telecoms giant at the centre of a spying row, as US authorities seek to extradite her. Wanzhou Meng was arrested in Vancouver on Saturday, it emerged on Wednesday night. American prosecutors are seeking to have her moved to the US as it investigates whether the company broke trade sanctions against Iran. It comes amid deepening suspicions of Huawei in the UK and elsewhere. On Wednesday, BT said it would remove the company’s equipment from its networks within two years, after more than a decade using it. Huawei was founde...
